keywords: TfL,Cycle Superhighway 11 CS11 construction travel advice maps
description: Cycle Superhighway 11 construction - travel advice and maps

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["Until September 2019 roads around Swiss Cottage will be busy while we build Cycle Superhighway 11. Here's how your journey may be affected."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
View the construction area and live traffic conditions on our traffic status map . View the map below for the impact of the works on traffic in the coming months or download the PDF.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Cycle Superhighway 11 traffic impact map","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/cs11trafficimpact.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 2.28MB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"How your journey could be affected"}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Driving"}
Drivers should expect some delays while travelling on the A41 Finchley Road through Swiss Cottage. Plan ahead and allow more time for your journey.
Lane closures, parking, and turning restrictions will be in place at different times during works. This will include parking restrictions on Finchley Road and borough roads.
The left- turn into College Crescent will be banned at times to facilitate works and will be permanently banned from mid-October 2018. Please follow signs.
For safety reasons, speed limits will be reduced to 20mph near work areas during construction.
Drivers should expect significant delays while travelling along Adelaide Road. If possible, you should consider using the tube, rail or bus to complete your journey through the area.
For the latest information on how London roads are operating, check before you travel and follow @TfLTrafficNews on Twitter for the latest updates.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Buses"}

From 30 July 2018, buses serving the area may experience delays while works are in place at Swiss Cottage. This could affect routes 13, 31, 46, 113, 187, 268, 603, C11, N28, N31 and N113. Please plan ahead and allow more time for your journey.
The following bus stops will be temporarily suspended with temporary stops nearby. Signs will be in place to direct you to the temporary stops:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Bus stop B on Finchley Road"]}
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Bus stop B on Finchley Road and bus stop F on College Crescent"]}
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Bus stop G and bus stop F on College Crescent"]}
We are doing all that we can to ensure your bus journey remains reliable, including:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["temporary bus stops to make your journey easier","Hopper fare - unlimited bus journeys in one hour for the price of one (using pay-as-you-go contactless or Oyster)"]}
Find out how your bus may be affected by visiting tfl.gov.uk/bus/status . You can also follow @TfLBusAlerts on Twitter for the latest updates.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Freight, deliveries and servicing"}

If you make or receive deliveries in the area, consider talking to your customers and suppliers now to see if there are changes you need to make, such as retiming to outside the busiest periods. Visit our freight page for more information.
Loading bays will need to be suspended at times to facilitate works. These temporary changes will be clearly signed.
The project's Public Liaison Officer will visit businesses and other organisations along the route to keep them informed as the works progress and discuss alternative loading arrangements.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Pedestrians"}

Footpaths and pedestrian crossings will remain open wherever possible, although some temporary closures
or diversions may be needed. Signs will be in place to safely guide you through the works area.
Shops and businesses in the area will be open throughout the works, and pedestrian access will be maintained.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Cyclists"}
Signage will be in place to help cyclists during works. We will also carry out regular reviews of our traffic management to provide the safest environment possible for road users.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"What we're doing"}

As part of a network of Cycle Superhighways across London, Cycle Superhighway 11 (CS11) will give cyclists a clearer, safer route from Swiss Cottage to the West End. More information about the overall scheme can be found on the project webpage .
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Related works"}

Works are currently in progress to convert Baker Street and Gloucester Place to two-way traffic. The Wigmore Street pedestrian improvement works are being coordinated with the Baker Street two-way scheme to minimise impacts in the area.
For more information about the scheme, visit our Baker Street roadworks page.
Find out about all major roadworks in London by visiting our travel advice for road users page.
